name: Coin Horror
description:
Coin Horror is an abstract microgame for 2 players set in Myths of Cthulhu. Players must solve a case in the town of Arkham, and prevent at all costs the plans of the evil cultists.

To play you only need one board -from size of a coasters-, and a handful of coins.

In turn, players place coins on the board to score better than your opponent, while trying not to lose all the Stamina and Sanity. The game ends if any of these cases occurs:


    The fourth coin of Doom is placed.
    The two players can not put more coins or decide not to.
    Both players are eliminated.


The player with more Clue (Victory Points) wins the game.

name: Apocrypha Adventure Card Game: Box One – The World
description:
The Apocrypha Adventure Card Game allows you to play it as a cooperative card game, or with a game master as a role playing game. The world is on the brink of an apocalypse, set in motion by monsters only your characters can see. Gameplay is story-based, and features deck construction and character growth. Over time, characters will unlock repressed memory fragments that will add new powers. Each mission has a unique setup and goal, which often involves hunting down a true threat hiding among the cards at the nexuses that characters investigate.

The base game, called The World, comes with 584 cards, 20 six-sided dice, 1 rulebook, 1 storybook, 30 dividers, and 10 character stand-up tokens; The World contains the starting chapter of Candlepoint, Wisconsin, and also the Skinwalkers chapter. Eight more chapters appear in two expansions, The Flesh and The Devil, as well as the bonus chapter The Book of the Hybrids.

name: La traversée de la baie du Mont Saint-Michel à D
description:
The players are moving their pilgrims from one side of the bay to the other side. They use the three white dices to move to adjacent spaces (each space has a number form 1 to 6) or to jump over other pilgrims as a group effect. A gray dice cause good (collecting an archangel cube) and bad (quicksands) events to occur. Each turn the tide moves forward and any pilgrim reached by the tide drown.

From the publisher:

It cannot be stressed too often, you shouldn't attempt to cross the Mont Saint-Michel bay without an experienced guide.
Be warned, if you attempt this on your own, you do so entirely at your own risk. Crossing the bay is certainly no picnic!
You'll need to keep clear of the quicksands, take a biscuit break at the right moment and, above all, keep a careful watch
on the rising tide in order to reach your goal. Luckily for you, archangel Saint-Michel is there to help...

Capitalise on the best combinations of the dice, making good use of the biscuit pieces and archangel cubes to move forward as quickly as
possible. The winner is the first player to reach the Mont Saint-Michel with their two pilgrims.
If everyone is washed away by the tide, then no one wins, unless someone has taken refuge at Tombelaine.

name: 4 the Birds
description:
4 the Birds is the board game in which you will use beak-and-taloned strategy as well as a peck of luck to be the first to "flock" four of your birds together in a tree besieged by a menagerie of other birds trying to do the same. By constantly balancing the goal of flocking your own birds and "Flock-Blocking" opponents' birds, a see-saw battle for avian supremacy ensues — and beware the non-player bird-baddies (crows and hawks) that can swoop in to un-nest a would-be winner.

Gameplay is simple. Each player rolls two dice on their turn to indicating coordinates on the game board grid (the tree) to place and move your six birds on the board. Each turn a player has the choice to place a bird at the rolled coordinate or play one of seven Action Cards as they work to achieve the winning formation of a four bird flock (either a square or straight line on the grid).


    Fast and easy to learn and play 
    Finely balanced mix of luck and strategy 
    Territorial disputes between birds is resolved via novel "Pecking Order" 
    Introduces a unique slide mechanic when birds vie for the same spot on the boards 
    Non-player spoiler-birds (crows and hawks) add unique obstacles as well as chain-reaction board-reorganizing sliding and scattering 
    Truly an abstract "gateway" game that's great for kids' spatial and numerical skills (and even better for adults who are out of practice)

name: Beer Party
description:
Beer Party is a fast game card, in which players try to serve and drink more beer than the opponent.
The more you drink the closer you are to victory ,but the harder it will achieve it !

Players will play face down cards in columns that form the "jars" (setting the correct cards). You may consult cards and swap cards every turn, until someone decides to "drink" one. If you can drink 3 beers will have finished the game! Time to count points.


Beer Party es un juego de cartas rápido y de reglas simples, en el que los jugadores tratarán de servir y beber más cervezas que el rival. 
Cuantas más bebas más cerca estarás de la victoria, ¡pero más difícil será alcanzarla!

Los jugadores irán jugando cartas ocultas en columnas que formarán las "jarras". Estás cartas podrán consultarse y moverse cada turno, hasta que alguien decida "beber" una de ellas. Si consigues beber 3 cervezas ¡habrá terminado la partida! Hora de contar puntos.

name: Piñata Party
description:
You’ve been invited to an awesome piñata party! Ready! Steady! Hit them as hard as you can!

The candies are dropping from the Piñata like flies. Hurry! Don't miss any of these delicious candies with flavors such as green apple and crispy cherry. Who can collect the most candies?

In Piñata Party, the players try to collect as many candies as they can from the board. On your turn, you must make two moves before picking up two or more candies. In every game there is different movement that can be used for collecting the sweets. Also included are several ways of scoring the game. The player that collects the most valuable delicious candy wins!

The game provides additional  challenges in the shape of new, more difficult movement and scoring cards. Tactics are vital to avoid others looting your desired sweets. The easier combinations provide a sweet challenge for families, while the more difficult are ideal for experienced players too. Includes a special card for use when playing with smaller children.

name: Labyrinth: The Paths of Destiny (Second Edition)
description:
Centuries ago a desert land existed in the world of the Eternal Kingdom. The land was rich from its many trade routes and populated by a nation called the People of the Book. Wise rulers had always reigned over them, and thanks to this everyone lived in prosperity. Even so, some had rebelled against the binding order, ignoring the venerable customs and breaking the law...

You are one of those renegades and "enemies of the kingdom", but you now have a second chance for freedom as this land's ruler prophesized that among you there is a chosen one who in the future will affect the fate of the desert lands. He decided that a trial in an ancient labyrinth would resolve who would be released and who would see daylight no more. The corridors of the labyrinth are winding and bristle with cleverly planned and dangerous pitfalls. Tales and legends also mention a guard, an immortal Golem that tramps the stone corridors.

Labyrinth: The Paths of Destiny 2 ed. is an adventure board game for 2-6 players who impersonate both the great constructors of the ancient labyrinth and the daredevils who try to escape.

To find a way out of the labyrinth, each player must find a special key while avoiding traps from other players, not to mention the Golem. With their two actions each turn, players can construct the multi-level labyrinth, set traps, move, rest, attack other players and much more.

name: Walt Disney's 101 Dalmatians
description:
Kids dice game. Roll two dice per turn, and pick up either one or two bones, based on the dice combination, or claim an empty bowl. The player with the most bones (or puppies in empty bowls) at the end of the game wins.
The box states a starting age of 7, but kids age 5+ should have no problem playing this.

From the box: Rolly, the tiny and ever-hungry Dalmatian puppy, is not the only one intent on hoarding as many bones as possible for himself. All his cute little friends are just as eager and make a dash, barking loudly, to empty the doggy bowls. The one who retrieves the greatest number of bones is the winner.

name: Auf dem Kriegspfade!
description: There are 9 red and 9 blue meeples in 3 different sizes. Each player has 3 meeples of the same color and size. The red meeples represent native American warriors of 3 tribes and the blue ones white settlers, cowboys and trappers. The players start at space 1 and try to reach space 70. Red and Blue travel in opposite directions on the blue or red path. On several spaces, there are special rules to observe, which are described in the game rules. The first player to get all 3 meeples to space 70 wins the game.

name: Bitten: An Erotic Game for Couples
description:
Do you love sexy vampires? Then this board game is for you! The board game is designed to be easily printed on 8.5”x11” paper or cardstock (or A4, for those not in the USA). You will need two regular decks of cards and dice (which you can find at almost any dollar store) for a night of sexy vampire fun with your partner. Fangs optional.

There are two major aspects to gameplay. The first aspect to the gameplay are the individual rooms (setup something like Clue). There are six rooms, each with a different theme. Within the rooms, players perform sexual or erotic tasks in order to earn poker cards. At the end of the game, the player with the best poker hand wins (although, if played correctly, both players really win ;) )

The second aspect of gameplay is the movement from one room to another. Players don't just move, they must perform various foreplay acts in order to successfully move their game piece.

name: Trambahn
description:
In Munich at the end of the 19th century, the successful new tramway needs expansion, and the two opposing players in Trambahn are competing for the contract.

To do this, in a grid marked by cards players use their cards in three different ways: as passengers on the trams, as suggested stops on new routes to be built, and as money to pay for these routes. When laying out cards for suggested stops, players need to both match colors and build them in ascending order — but they also need to bring passengers to this tram line in order to score victory points for it.

The cards resemble postcards that feature street cars in Munich and historical parts of the city.

name: Castle Combat
description:
A simple kids' CCG based off War. Starter sets are expandable with booster packs with over 200+ cards in the set.

Each player draws 3 cards and each turn plays cards simultaneously. Powers are resolved and each player rolls a die to add to the cards power. Highest number wins. Players place their winning cards into the Winner pile, and the defeated cards in their dungeon. First player to get all the other player's cards in the dungeon wins.

name: Puppy Dogs From Space
description:
Puppy Dogs From Space is a fast playing card game for 3-6 players where each player tries to assemble their team before the other puppy dog factions can. Players must balance getting their puppies assembled while also preventing opponents from doing the same with cards like ” flea infestation”, “the cone of shame”, or “the dinosaur bone”. Each puppy also has their own special power that can be used to help their faction accomplish it's mission.

Each player has the same 9 puppies and powers.  Players take their 9 puppies and shuffle 20 random cards from the 120 core cards to create their own draw deck.  This will randomize the cards from the core deck and the order their 9 puppies come out in play.  No two games are the same.

name: ADJitation
description:
64 cubes with different adjectives on all sides and 13 family-friendly and gamer-friendly games to play with them.

ADJItation is fun, funny - and subtly educational. Shake the cubes in the ADJitator(box) and you are ready to play.

Some of the games that challenge your mental ADJility are:

Spin Cycle- keep spinning cubes until you hit a stumper.
Dirty Laundry - find out what your friends really think.
Air Dry - an air-writing amusement.
Lonely Launderomat - create and repeat your own urban legend.
Clothesline - name the next alphabetical noun in line.

name: Love Letter: Adventure Time
description:
Adventure Time Love Letter is a game of risk, deduction, and luck for 2–4 players based on the original Love Letter game by Seiji Kanai, except re-themed with characters of the hit cartoon Adventure Time. Players are suitors trying to gain the affections of Princess Bubblegum (#8).

In a round, each player starts with only one card in hand; one card is removed from play. On a turn, you draw one card, and discard one of the two, using the power of the discarded card to try to eliminate other players from the round. If you're the last player in the round, or the player with the highest card when the deck runs out, then you score a point. The game is played until a player reaches a certain amount of points determined by the numbers of players.

The card art is styled to be Adventure Time characters "cosplaying" the characters from the Tempest version of Love Letter by AEG.

There are two differences in this version. Number 1 is a new win condition. If a player plays a "Hero" (#5), either Finn or Jake, and makes another player (including themselves) discard the other "Hero" card, they win the round. The idea is that you are reuniting the iconic best buds. Number 2 is, if you manage to win the round with a "companion" in your hand, you win 2 tokens instead of only one.

name: Möllanspelet
description: A local "monopoly game", about an area in Malmö, Sweden called "Möllan".

name: Allons zo Zoo
description:
The game is to create a panorama of a visit to the zoo. All 30 cards that make up this scene are numbered. Each player gets 5 cards and the top card on the draw pile is revealed. This is the start card.

In her turn, a player must play a card (if she has one that fits) one before or one after the card on the table. Thus the panorama is created. At the end of her turn, whether she played a valid card or not, she draws a new card from the draw-pile.If there are no cards in the draw-pile, she ends her turn by drawing a card from the hand of the player on her right.

The Zookeeper is a Joker. Once played, if a player has the correct card which the Keeper has replaced, that player may play that card and take the Joker for herself. The Snake card acts like an Old Maid card in that whoever has it when the panorama is complete, loses.

name: AARRR!
description:
Hand-illustrated card game, fast duel of two Captains.

"Choose a ship and place in front of you. Remove cannon cards from the deck (each player takes four and places them in front of their ship.) Shuffle the remaining cards and deal five cards to you and your opponent. Place the remaining cards and the hole markers between you; leave some space for the discard pile (e.g. used cannonballs, parrot, spyglass). Player take turns. You can play two cards for turn (e.g. you can load your cannon using 'the cannonball' card and then fire it by using 'the boom' card). At the end of your turn draw cards from the draw pile, so that you have five cards in your hand. It's your opponent's turn now. 
(...)The game can be completed in two ways: when the deck is depleted, or when there are no cannons on one of the ships(...)"

More details are described in the manual.

name: Inspector
description:
The object is to collect the most possible of a complete “set” of cards in sequence before the Inspector turns up. A valid set of cards is either a;
Male Nudist + Shirt + Trousers + Tie + Shoes (M) + Hat (M) + Pipe
or
Female Nudist + Undies + Jumper + Skirt + Shoes (F) Hat (F) + Gloves.

METHOD OF PLAY
The dealer gives one unexposed card to each player, places the rest of the pack face down on the table and turns up the top card which is put face up near the pack.
In the event of the Inspector being dealt or turned up in this round (the first of any hand), the cards are reshuffled and the next player on left of dealer deals.
The player on the left of dealer must now choose two cards, the exposed one and one from the pack or two from the pack.
He then discards one, placing it face up on the exposed heap.
The next player does the same, until the Inspector is brought into play. On turning up the Inspector, the player must call “Inspector” at which all hands are exposed on the table.

SCORING
Player turning up “Inspector” counts “ 0 ” for hand.
The numbers on the cards headed by a nudist and in sequence, of the same set, are not counted.
But all cards not of the same set, and not in sequence, are added and scored against player.
If a player has two or more Nudists, 12 points is counted for each one after the first.

REMNANT CARD
Player holding “Remnant Card”, may call it any card except a Nudist, but if it is found in a hand, when inspected, not holding a Nudist, it counts 15 points against the player.

THE WINNER
The player with the least number of points after playing as many deals as there are players wins

name: Redemption Prize
description:
DESCRIPTION:
Your family is away on vacation and having a blast.  Unfortunately, your big sister was not able to come along.  Since you're at the arcade for the afternoon, you've decided to get her the best prize you can in the redemption center to bring home.  Your family thinks that is a great idea, and wants to do the same.

Since your family is a little competitive, everyone wants to get the most tickets for the best prize.  It's game on!

GAME OBJECTIVE:
Gain as many redemption tickets as possible by playing games with your limited coins

GAMEPLAY:
Players play games of various difficulty by matching squares based upon color, shape, and numbers.  Half of the players will be active each turn.  Each turn is timed, so players have a limited time to complete matches.  The more matches made, the higher the prize.

GAME ELEMENTS:

    Timed card matching
    Variable game difficulty, with higher risk/rewards
    Each player is active (at least) every other turn

name: Fog of Love
description:
Fog of Love is a game for two players. You will create and play two vivid characters who meet, fall in love and face the challenge of making an unusual relationship work.

Playing Fog of Love is like being in a romantic comedy: roller-coaster rides, awkward situations, lots of laughs and plenty of difficult compromises to make.

Much as in a real relationship, goals might be at odds. You can try to change, keep being relentless or even secretly decide to be a Heartbreaker. It’s your choice.

The happily ever after won’t be certain, but whatever way your zigzag romance unfolds, you’ll always end up with a story full of surprises – guaranteed to raise a smile!

name: Wrathborne Champions
description:
You and your friends have been chosen by the gods to become Wrathborne; the strongest fighters the world has ever known! Using special class skills, unique weapons, and a few items, you must work together to defeat monsters intent on destroying the civilized world. This fully cooperative game will require your party to tactically dismantle each enemy in a different way before all of you are out of options. Whether casual or hardcore, Wrathborne Champions is the perfect game for all those brave enough to face the monsters' wrath.

Each player is assigned a deck of cards comprised of their specific class abilities, a series of attacks specific to the weapon they are using this game, and a few personally selected items. These decks control not only the moves available to players, but also their life total, with damage being applied directly to the deck itself.

Player fight against one or more giant monsters printed on 10x10 miniboards placed in the center of the play area. Unlike most "big bad" games, the Monster Cards in Wrathborne Champions have set attacks and actions performed each round. This "AI code" lets players predict a great deal of how the monsters will act, allowing them to make tactical choices during their turns to increase the likelihood of success.

Monster Card life is tracked via Life Cards in a similar fashion to player decks. Most of these life cards are benign, but some alter the state of play dynamically, sometimes twisting the control out of the player's hands. Players defeat a Monster Card when all Life Cards are removed from the sectors of the Monster Card that can attack. The game ends when the last Monster Card is defeated, or the final player is killed.

name: Cast & Capture
description:
Cast & Capture is a unique and innovative take on classic fishing card games (ex. Casino).

In Cast & Capture, you are a mage specializing in the collection of wondrous creatures for the Arcane Academy.  You must use your knowledge of the elements and arcane powers to capture a variety of mystical and magical creatures before your fellow mages.  It is only by using your wits to blend the right spells and group the right creatures that you can earn the title of Master Capturer.

There are 2 decks in the game: a Creature deck and a Spell Deck. Each creature and Spell have a Power and Element tied to them. To begin, mages are given 4 Spells at random from the Spell deck and 4 creatures are placed on the field.  Each turn a new creature will come onto the field and the mage whose turn it is will use their Spells to attempt to capture any number of creatures on the field that match the Power and Element of the Spell they cast.  If they cannot capture a creature, then their spell is added to the Spell Pool to be used by any mage. Mages refresh their hand of Spells when they run out.

Using the Spell Blending and Creature Grouping mechanics, mages will use light strategy and symbol recognition to blend spells to create new ones and even group creatures together to make bizarre and whimsical combinations.  By mastering Blending/Grouping, it helps the mage to ensure that the right spell is always at hand and maximum number of creatures are captured per spell.

With beautiful, hand-drawn illustrations and a unique split-card, dual-deck design; Cast and Capture updates an old gaming favorite for a new generation of players both young and old.

name: CARRIER STRIKE FORCE: A Solitaire Game of Carrier Operations in the Pacific (1942-1945)
description:
INTRODUCTION
CARRIER STRIKE FORCE is a Game where you are a Commander of a Carrier Air Group (CAG) in the Pacific during World War II (1942-1945). Your Goal is to manage your aircraft to successfully search for and destroy Japanese Naval, Air and Ground Forces in order to bring victory to the allied forces.

OBJECTIVE
The Objective of CARRIER STRIKE FORCE is to score a pre-determined number of Victory Points (VP) by destroying Japanese Naval, Air and Ground Units. The US has up to 24 Turns to Control at least 150 VP worth of Bases OR have destroyed at least 60 VP worth of Japanese Ships and Aircraft. If the Player does not accomplish this, the Player loses and Victory is uncertain for the Allies.

GAME FEATURES
CARRIER STRIKE FORCE is a BIG Game with many counters and a 6-Sheet Map with large Hexes. Aircraft include F4F Wildcats, F6F Hellcats, F4U Corsairs, SBD Dauntless Dive Bombers, TBF Avenger Torpedo Bombers, A6M Zero Fighters, D3A Val Dive Bombers, B5N Kate Torpedo Bombers and G4M Betty Medium Bombers. Ships include Destroyers, Light and Heavy Cruisers, Battle Ships and Carriers. Ground units include Artillery batteries, Anti-Aircraft Batteries, and Convoys.

CARRIER STRIKE FORCE can be found at the following URL: 
http://www.berserkergames.net/

name: Smorgasboard
description:
Smorgasboard is a board game for foodies, friends and family alike. Players take on the guide of aspiring chefs as they work their way around the board in search of gastronomic success.

The object of the game is to be the first team of chefs to graduate from Rick's Culinary Academy by answering questions from the following categories:

4BIDDEN-FRUIT
KITCHEN-KAOS
NUUDLE-DOODLE
TASTO-QUEST

Basically a food and drink based variant of Trivial Pursuit for 2-4 players/teams.

name: The Undercity: An Iron Kingdoms Adventure Board Game
description:
The Undercity puts a spin on the classic dungeon crawl adventure, setting it within the vast underground labyrinth of one of the Iron Kingdoms’ most famous cities.

This board game for two to four players comes with a seven-adventure campaign. The players play one to four characters from the Iron Kingdoms universe as they try to weed out a nefarious evil that has been lurking in the Undercity of Corvis.

All players will be playing on the same team and the game requires no game master. The players work together defeating enemies, achieving objectives, and gaining experience that can be used to give new skills to their characters that can be used in subsequent adventures in the campaign.

The game will come with almost 40 different miniatures with 16 different sculpts. The four heroes are Milo Boggs (the alchemist), Canice Gormleigh (the gun mage), Gardek Stonebrow (a trollkin warrior), and Pog (a gobber mechanic) that controls a light warjack named Doorstop.

Each character has a starting stat sheet, but players can purchase character ability cards with XP gained from the adventure to enhance and customize their characters.

Combat is based on rolling dice against opposing attributes. Players will be able to use feats and abilities to give boosts to these dice rolls, similar in many ways to other games based in the Iron Kingdoms.

name: W1815
description:
W1815 is a simple strategy game that simulates the key events of the battle of Waterloo in 15 minutes. The French side can try a number of different strategies in an attempt to crush the Anglo-Allied army before the Prussians arrive. Meanwhile, the Anglo-Allied player must focus on keeping his army in the battle by using reserves in right situations until the Prussians get into the action.

The game contains a battlefield map which is used to record casualties and the current strength of the participating armies. The cards are setup around the battlefield map with each card representing a corps. Players take it in turns to activate one corps and carry out an action. The rules for each individual corps action are described on the cards. The results of these actions are then recorded on the battlefield map. The game ends when either army fails a rout test or the time marker is moved to the night square.

name: Modern Africa: Rules for modern skirmish battles on the dark continent
description:
Modern Africa is a set of rules to fight/refight battles on the dark continent in the 1960´s through the 1990´s. The majority of these battles were smaller scale fought between warlords or other dictators. The arms were either leftovers from an earlier era, state-sponsor (US or USSR) supplied, or black market purchased. These are not the latest, greatest weaponry and they may not even be welded by trained soldiers, but the goal was always freedom.
The game is played with 15mm miniatures.

name: Glaisher
description: In the two-player game Glaisher, players separate and move their stacks in order to connect the opposite sides of the board. The mechanisms for separation and movement of stacks are dictated by integer partitions with distinct parts, i.e., splitting numbers into sets of different smaller numbers. Players might recognize this mechanism from Kakuro puzzles. The game is therefore named after mathematician James Glaisher, who devised a theorem about integer partitions.

name: El Juego del Come Come
description: Every player has to get as many of their markers to the opposite edge, preferably in the right order, thus achieving the highest points. They must also avoid losing their markers, if one of your markers goes off the sidelines on your left or right, or if your market is "eaten" by other player.

name: Salamander Verkehrs-Zeichen-Spiel
description: The players begin at the parking lot near space 1. Movement is determined by a die. The first player to reach space 48 at the Salamander shoe store wins the game. At severaL spaces special rules are printed on the game board.

name: Boerderij Spel
description:
A farm isn't a farm without it's animals. Throw the dice, move your pawn and purchase the animals and machines by paying the requested amount. Primary goal of this game is to purchase the animals related to your farm. First one to succeed is the winner of the game.

An educative game of trade and luck

name: Wer kann lesen?
description:
Four games to learn reading.

Game 1 (alphabet game): Match upper and lower case letters.

Game 2 (caterpillar game): Find the matching words for given starting letters.

Game 3 (pictures and words): Find the matching words for given pictures.

Game 4 (pictures and letters): Create the words for given pictures.

name: Ernies und Berts Farben-Memo
description: Memory-type game with lots of characters from Sesame Street to learn matching colors and shapes.

name: Yippi
description:
A wild-west adventure with Benjamin Blümchen and his friends, Otto, Chief Black Feather and his daughter, Red Feather.

Twelve Cattle were stolen and must now be returned home. But the way home is hard to find: you turn right, then left and sometimes there is no way! You have to look closely and build the way anew, relocating the game boards if nescessary.

To play, the 16 large game boards are laid out in a 4x4 grid on the floor.

Each cattle is assembled by putting the die-cut cattle in a colored standee. Then, the cattle are randomly distributed between the players. All players start at the same spot on the grid, Mike Donalds Ranch.

On your turn, a player throws the die and moves his pawn along the way, one field for each pip. The goal is to reach the color-coded pasture, matching the color of one of his cattle. To do this, it is allowed to change the grid of game boards to open up new paths and maybe hinder the other players on their plans. The first player to place all his cattle in the right pastures wins the game!

name: Perfekt auswärts: Urlaubs-Französisch
description:
Learn first language ability with this game!

The game is played in four rounds. In the first round, you only use the cards 1 to 10 and the blue cardboard counters. Shuffle the cardboard counters face down. Give each player a card with a short phrase in french on it, the lowest number starts then. Pick up a cardboard counter and read the word aloud (it is written both in latin letters and in phonetics). Each player listens carefully, and says "yes" if he thinks this word belongs to his card. He then put the counter on his tray. If the sentence from his card is now complete, he reads it to the other players and gives a translation. The translation can be checked with the translation wheel. If it is correct, he keeps the card, otherwise the first player giving a correct translation gets the card. A round is played until all cardboard counters are gone. Then you start another round with new cards and new counters. Afer four rounds, the player with the most cards is the winner.

name: Der Smaragd des Maharadschas
description:
The game plays in the palace of a maharajah. It's a mixture of board game and role play.

A crime has happened: a smaragd was stolen. The players try to find out, what happened and which Person(s) have committed the crime.

Each player gets a character (Maharajah, Maharani, Guru, ...), and instructions on how to play their character.

There are 2 parts:

     Moving a pawn around the plan of the palace by rolling a die to find objects.
     Interrogate the other players to get more information.


Both should lead the players as team or against each other to solve the crime.

name: Vorsicht Stufe!
description:
Be the first to lay all your stair parts on the gameboard to win! A simple color and recognition game for younger kids.

Each player gets stair parts in different lenghts (10 with 2 players, 7 with 3 and 6 with 4). Spinn the color wheel and put one of your stair parts on the matching stair on the game board with exactly two persons step on it. It is possible that you can't place a any of your stair parts (no matching size, not able to match exactly two persons, not enough free space on the chosen stair). If so, you must collect all stair parts from the chosen stair. The player who has placed sucessfully all of his stair parts is the winner!

name: Suchen und finden
description: Charlie and Lola are always in the middle of the action! Lola likes to play with her friend Lotta, drinks strawberry milk or goes on a walk with Sizzles. Charlie likes to play soccer with his friend Marv or looks after his little sister. But what exactly is happening? Two spinners show which tile the players must find, as fast as possible! Whoever got six tiles, wins!

name: Teenage Mutant Hero Turtles: Pizza-Memo
description:
Teenage Mutant Hero Turtles need their pizzas badly!

Shuffle the 16 pizza pieces facedown and lay them in a 4x4 pattern facedown on the table.

Each player gets a Turtle board with its 9 matching counters. On his turn, a player turns pizza pieces face up as long as they all are matching. He stops after the first different piece and turns all pieces facedown. Then it's the next players turn. If a player happens to find all four pieces, he fills his Turtle board with four of his nine counters. The second completed pizza only nets three counters, the third two counters and the fourth and last pizza only one counter. When all four pizzas are found, the pieces are shuffled and placed anew. The first player to place all his nine counters on his turtle board wins!

name: Dora Tip & Flip
description:
Dora Tip & Flip a educative Memory game with a special flip mechanic based on the series character Dora.

There are some variants in playing:

    Normal searching of pairs
    Searching a Special pair given by a Card
    Searching a Special pair given by the English Name on the Card.

name: Rot! Achtung! Ampel!
description:
A traffic game with dice and event cards.

Each player rolls the six-sided die and moves his pawn around the game board. At a roll of "1" you draw an event card and follow the instructions. At a roll of "6" you may roll and move again. The goal is to collect a picture card in each shop visited. Be the first to have 6 cards and win the game.

name: Benjamin Blümchen: Lern das ABC!
description:
Four different game variants to learn the alphabet with Benjamin Blümchen!

The games included are:

Color-Dominoes, where player have to match color-coded buffers of the waggons. If done right, the ape is in the first, the bear in the second, the chameleon in the third waggon and so on until the zebra in the last waggon. The player to match all of his waggon tiles first, wins.

Color-Memo, where the train build in the first game is used again. Here, the waggons are turned on the other sid, where only a color and a uppercase letter is visible. All players use now the pawn showing Benjamin Blümchen and a six-sided die to walk along the train. Where Benjamin stopps, the player must name the animal in the waggon. If correct, the player gets the matching card. When all cards are found, the player with the most cards wins.

A B C game. The waggons must be added in the correct sequence, the color-coded buffers are used for self-control. Can be played by one player or cooperatively.

Where is my waggon? Each animal wants to find his own waggon. All the waggons are shuffled and laid out in the middle of the table, showing only the backside. The cards are also used again here. A card is drawn and the animal on it announced. The player to the right of the card drawer is the first to try to find the matching waggon. If he is correct, he gets the card, otherwise the next player tries it. When all cards are found, the player with the most cards wins.

name: Chef, ärgere dich nicht!: Das Spiel um Wissen und Karriere
description:
This game is a party game. The story behind it is making career in your company. The career level is shown by the position of your figure in the company building.

You go your way up by rolling the dice and fulfilling your tasks. These tasks can be knowledge questions (getting harder the higher you come on your career) and actions. Both tasks are given by cards to be taken on action fields.

Actions could be e.g. making gymnastic lessons or kiss the other players.

name: 101 Dalmatians: The game based on the film
description:
Cruella, the cruel fashion designer holds many little Dalamatian puppies hostage in Hell Hall to make their pretty coats into elegants furs. She did not, however, reckon with Pongo, Perdy, Fogey and Sergeant Tips. These four are on their way to release the puppies. Teh player who can release the most puppies from Hell Hall and bring them home has won the game.

Three routes are going to Hell Hall, where you can find the puppies. Choose the short one, and test your luck. Cruella may hide here often and takes the puppies away. On the long one, your odds are better and you may find a soot chip to mask your puppies. The last route goes over the river and you face the chance to hit the water, losing your puppies to Cruella again!

name: Noah und die Tiere
description:
A memory game with a twist.

Shuffle the 40 tiles and place them facedown on the table. Get each player a board. On your turn, turn two tiles face up. If you find a pair of an animal or Mama Noah and Papa Noah, place them on your board. Else, turn the tiles face down and pass the turn. The first player to completely fill his board with Mama and Papa Noah and four pairs of animals wins the game.

name: Farben lernen
description:
Learn the colors and match them with pictures. Three learning games in one box.

Variant 1:
Three cards make a set. These sets are marked with a little animal (a bug). If you place cards of one set side by side, the bugs match each other, when placed correct. 
Shuffle all 36 cards and place them faceup on the table. On your turn, throw the die. On 2, 4 or 6 take any one card from the table and place it front of yourself. On 1, 3 or 5 pass the turn to the next player. Try to collect all three cards of a set. No one may take a card belonging to a set started by another player. You may start a new set only after you finished a set. The game ends when all cards are collected. The player with the most cards in front of him wins.

Variant 2:
Memory - play with the 24 picture cards or with all 36 cards. If played with 36 cards, always turn up three cards and try to find the matching triplets.

Variant 3:
I spy with my litte eye something ... Use the color cards to determine the color to spy and use the chips as victory points.

name: Give the Dog a Bone
description:
Short print run dexterity and dice game from Waddingtons. Players pull back and release Barney the dog to propel him around a track looking to uncover a number of bones buried at points along the track by the players as determined by a die roll.

Play continues until all 40 bones have been uncovered, the player with the most wins.

name: Gunship Platoon: A Solitaire Game of Helicopter Gunship Combat in Vietnam (1965-1973).
description:
GUNSHIP PLATOON is a Game where you are a Commander of Platoon of Helicopter Gunships (the Gun Platoon) in a Helicopter Assault Company in Vietnam. Your Goal is to manage your aircraft and Complete a Campaign consisting of a series of Missions and score as many Victory Points (VP) as possible to assist the war efforts. Campaigns can be Short (8 Missions), Moderate (12 Missions), or Long (16 Missions). Combat is based on an innovated Initiative system that allows a single player to manage many units and gives the feeling of lining up a strafing run.

GAME FEATURES: GUNSHIP PLATOON features many colorful game counters of a large variety of Units including UH-1D and UH-B Hueys, OH-6 Cayuse and AH-1 Cobras, US Aero-Rifle Squads, VC and NVA infantry, M-113s, M-48s, T-54s, PT-76s and others.

GUNSHIP PLATOON can be found at the following URL: 
http://www.berserkergames.net/

name: Kampf um Wildpferde
description:
Each player has 4 cowboys in 4 colors (each player the same).
A player start with 1 field diagonal movement each turn.
After the player has reached special marked fields with all 4 cowboys, he now moves like the chess horse trying to get on the field were the wild horses are placed at the begin of the game.
Reaching one of them he brings it with the same kind of moves back to his ranch.

There is one White Mustang on the field this can be caught by one Player in the same way after bringing 3 wild horses back to the ranch.

Game ends after a preset number of rounds.

Wild horses in the ranch 10 Points, on the way to the ranch 5 Points, White Mustang in the ranch 20 Points.
Special rule: The Player has to choose a different Color as the openent had chosen on his last turn.

name: Das Quiz-Spiel mit der Maus
description:
Based on the high-flying German TV franchise "Die Sendung mit der Maus", Das Quiz-Spiel mit der Maus is a family game that requires you to puzzle, guess, combine, and evaluate.

The game board shows many different tasks to solve, placed in a circular course. Your goal is to race once around the course and be the first to reach your starting point again. Each field gives you another task to solve. It is always you against all others. If you succeed, you step one field forward, otherwise all other players step one field forward. The tasks test your knowledge, your evaluation skills, your memory, and your dice-throwing skills.

name: Our Town Trivia: Camp Rockwood
description: Players move around the board and must answer trivia questions from one of four color categories matching the space they are on, for the level (1 thru 5) they are currently on in order to continue their turn. If space is indicated as a bridge, advance to the next level. Correctly answer a Level 5 question and win the game.

name: Spaßvogel Spiel: Städteflug-Spiel
description:
Spaßvogel Spiel is  a role-and-move game.
The track has 3 parts.

Each Player has to collect a full set of city Cards to get in the next part of the track (1st and 2nd part).
There are fields with the city names. Each time a player hits one of these fields he gets one of the cards of this city. 
Due to the fact that the number of cards of 1 City is limited the player gets the card from another player if he knows who has this card.

The third part is only a short part to come to the finish field. 
There are some special event fields (fixed events and card driven). Cards are for example: Joker city-Card, Exchange city-Cards, has to skip 1 or 2 turns.

name: Zingeln
description:
A exciting encircle game for 2 players played in a 4x4 grid with a few special spaces.

The aim of the game is to encircle the opponent in 21 turns so that he is unable to move.

Setup:
The five blue pawns are set up in the 4x4 grid in the spaces with a single circle at one corner of the board. The green pawn is started in the opposite corner in a space with a double circle. This circular field markings apply only to the starting positions.

Movement:
The player  with the green pawn starts and counts his turns. He may move orthogonality (forward, backward, up or down) and diagonally. The blue pawn may only move move orthogonality. Turns are take alternately, moving always only one pawn. Skipping over another pawn is not allowed.

Object:
The player with the blue pawns must now try to encircle his opponent so that he can not move anymore. If he can do that in at last 21 turns, he's the winner. Otherwise, the other player has won.

Trivia:
"Zingeln" is a non-existent short form of "umzingeln", meaning encircling in german.

name: Poleaxed 2
description:
From the intro:

"The Poleaxed wargames system is designed to represent, as far as possible, the type of warfare that was waged in Western Europe during the 15th century.

The prime aim of the system has always been to wargame large battles, to get a clear cut result (pun intended) and to bring out the flavor of the period.  To do this, the rule mechanisms have been made as simple as possible.  Morale checks and book-keeping are kept to a minimum.  The need to remove figures has been eliminated and all movement can be carried out by contingents on movement trays."

name: Mein erstes Rechnen
description:
Learing by playing, that's fun!

variant 1,2: Memory. Match the number card with the picture card showing excatly this number of items. In the second variant, use the plus card also.

variant 3: Place the 12 number cards faceup on the table. Shuffle plus and minus cards into one stack. On your turn, draw a card from the stack and read one of the tasks on it to the next player, clockwise. If he can solve the task by pointing to the correct number card on the table, he gets the task card, otherwise the next player has a chance to solve it. Whoever gets to solve six tasks first is the winner!

name: Die Montagsmaler
description:
This game is based on a German TV game show.

The game is played in 2 teams.
On teams turn one member is chosen.

He looks on a card what he has to draw. His team members try to name the Thing as fast as possible. If this is right the drawer takes the next card and starts drawing this.
This continues till the time has gone (hourglass finished).
Each card gives 1 Point and the other team, makes the same with new cards.

The game ends after each Player was the drawer.

name: Ruck und Sack: ein Aufstieg mit Haken
description:
In this game the players climb a mountain.
The mountain is a 3D pyramid, build out of 4 triangles.
This mountain has many holes, which are connected to a net of paths. Each hole is marked with a colored ring around.
On players turn he rolls a dice, and decides which path he wants to go with exact this number of holes.
If there is already a hook placed, he can hang his backpack (marks the players positon) on this.
Is there is no hook he has to make an action or answer a question (dependent on the hole color). If he was successful he can place a new hook and place his backpack on it.
For some cards and wrong answered questions the player gets garbage.
To win the game, the player must had climbing on all four sides of the mountain (called 4 seasons of the year) and reach the Peak cross first. This is only allowed if the player has no garbage. The garbage can be reduced with some of the actions done or some Kind of questions answered. Sometimes just with getting the right card on the action Points you reduce garbage.

For more than 4 players there is a team rule included.

name: Aura
description:
What does your Aura reveal?

• Aura is an easy to learn, but difficult to master, strategy card game for 2-4 players.  
• Enjoyed by casual and hardcore gamers alike, Aura is the perfect gateway into the world of modern card games.  
• Outwit and bluff your way to victory, but remain flexible, because when the cards are revealed anything can happen.

Begin the game with your own deck of cards.  Five distinct types of cards are represented by the five colors in your deck.  The colors are visible on both the backs and fronts of each card to give the effect of an observable aura when in your hand.  Take turns playing cards face down in an attempt to both protect your deck and to remove cards from your opponents’ deck.  Win by having the most cards remaining at the end of the game.

name: Das Geheimnis der Zahleninsel
description:
Solve the math problems and collect the treasure chests on this mysterious island with TIPTOI interactive learningsystem.

The treasure chests on this island are guarded by a parrot, a mermaid, a dolphin and a pirate. They teach simple math problems to the players during their turn. If the player solves the problem he can keep the treasure chest. The player who collects the most treasures wins the game.

The game contains four difficulty levels.

name: The Board: Fantasy skirmish wargame
description:
The Board: Fantasy skirmish wargame.
Chapter One: The Frondglaucous Conflict.

In a world of God and mortals, several races fighting for control of The Triple Gift. Make a band of humans, dwarves, ugris, samaris, egir, sorgoins (snake-humans), alares, mercenaries...

In this chaptes you can use both dwarves and ugris.

name: Bible Hunter
description:
Bible Hunter is a card game with themes from the Old and New testament, with artwork in manga style. The game has three types of cards, characters (red cards), that can be persons like the patriarchs or prophets, Jesus or the apostles, and items, like swords or money (green), and mission cards (blue).

Players starts with four cards, two characters and two missions. The players take turns, selects one of the three cards on the board, and then tries to collect this by playing one character card. The strongest character gets the card. It is good to have strong characters, but some of the gives minus points if in hand then a round is completed, eg. Satan (-20 victory points)

The cards collected can be put together to complete a story. The round ends then a player can complete a whole biblical story, and then all players count there victory points. The game is played in three rounds, and the player with most victory points after the third round is the winner.

name: Capital Edition
description:
From the rules:
"Capital Edition is designed to help you enjoy Washington, D.C. before and after you visit."

Capital Edition is a roll-and-move trivia game designed to teach players about Washington, D.C.  Players start at the beginning of a track printed around the outer edge of the board.  On each turn, they roll the die and move along the track, landing on one of many types of spaces.  On a monument space, the player gains the trophy card for that monument.  A Metro space allows a player to move to any other Metro space.  A Tourmobile space allows movement to any monument, but the player must answer a question from a Challenge card to win a trophy card.  On a challenge space, the player draws a challenge card and asks another player the question.  On an incorrect answer, that player must return a trophy card to the board.  On a take a card space, the player must choose a card and answer the question to continue.  There are also roll again and lose a turn spaces.

Players' turns end in one of four ways--answering a question incorrectly, answering three consecutive questions correctly, winning a trophy card or landing on a "lose a turn" square.

Players continue to circle the board until one player collects trophy cards for all four monuments, winning the game.

name: Trojan Challenge
description:
Developed by University of Southern California Alumni, Trojan Challenge is a Monopoly-type game where players move around a track, landing on activity spaces which represents conferences, exhibits, performances, athletic contests and other events at the university.  When a player lands on an activity space, he may purchase that activity for the designated cost.  He may then purchase up to two upgrades (which are called "reserved tables," "group reservations," etc.) either immediately or on a later turn.  When other players land on these spaces, they must pay the owner the amount designated on the card.

A few extra wrinkles are added.  Detour spaces place a player onto an alternate track when they are landed on.  "Go Trojans Go!" and "We Are SC" cards can give players extra money, take away money or offer other benefits or detriments.  Parking Lot spaces cause loss of a turn, and various other spaces may increase or decrease the player's money total.  Passing the start space, unlike in Monopoly, costs the player $600.

Players start with $6000 each (tracked on paper--no paper money is included) and try to gain funds as they play.  Landing on other players' spaces forces a player to pay them a designated amount.  If a player cannot pay, he or she may sell any assets owned to other players or give them back to the bank for half value.  If still unable to pay in full, the player is out of the game.  The game can be played to one of three pre-agreed ending conditions--a time limit, until one or more player are eliminated or until only player is left.  The player with the most money wins.

Optional rules allow a player to move another player back to the starting space by landing on their pawn and allow for discounted purchase of upgrades on spaces if matching sets are collected.

A metagame rule governs the use of a "Trojan Gold" space.  If a player lands on this space and agrees to donate a pre-determined amount of real (not in-game) money to the real University of Southern California, he or she gains an upgrade to place on any owned property.

name: TKG ARENA: The Lost Worlds
description:
The great armies of the Elemental Kings march from the furthest corners of the known world and beyond.

In this expansion, each player uses a TKG ARENA Standard Deck and shares 11 action tiles to explore, move, build, harvest, raid, trade, deconstruct, purge, consolidate, seal and emulate their enemies across 48 different world tiles as the TKG ARENA universe unfolds ...

This game requires the following components from TKG ARENA: The Elemental Kings & TKG ARENA: Rise of the Magi:

STANDARD DECK (DECK):    1 for each player
OINKS:    20 from each element for each player (Default)
LIFE:    9 - 18 for each player (Variable)

New components for this expansion.

STARTING PLAYER TOKEN: 1
PLAYER TOKEN:    1 for each player
ACTION TILES:    11
WORLD TILES    48

To win the game, players accrue victory points pertaining to the amount of Elemental Oinks they harvest from the worlds and the presence (in terms of Life tokens) established in each of these worlds. As their trusted generals, the Elemental Kings expect players to conquer these spaces, reap their resources towards their own campaigns and bring those who tries to stop them to their knees.

The Arena has just got bigger ...

name: Long way home
description:
Long way home is a game for 3 to 6 players about a drunk guy trying to get home. But, due to his drunkenness, he gets a lot of ideas. Some of them are good, some of them not so much. But all of them sound fun. At least to him.

In a game players are playing as ideas in a drunk guys head. They are controlling him, and his actions, trying to achieve secret objectives. There are two types of objectives, big ones, that happen at the end of the game, and small ones that are scored when done. Big objectives are connected to finishing the game - Get home in time, Give wife flowers, sober up, or lose consciousness in bar, while small objectives are different, some logical (eat a hamburger, drink coffee), some irrational (punch person in bar), and some just plain crazy (eat a flower, punch a wall).

The game is print and play, and files and rules can be found in files section.

name: Benedict Arnold and the Northern Theater
description:
An insightful strategist and leader of men, Benedict Arnold was the true hero of the Battles of Saratoga in 1777, which resulted in a formal alliance with France and the turning point of the American Revolution.

Operating in the Northern Department (the northern theater of the war), Arnold worked tirelessly in the cause of liberty for years. If he had died at Saratoga instead of being seriously wounded, his legacy would have been nothing short of legendary.

Benedict Arnold and the Northern Theater is designed to provide players with a neglected yet important slice of history -- and, using the Do or Die Roll(TM) game system -- an easy-playing, exciting gaming experience for both experienced wargamers and newbies alike.

Now in development with a well-known, respected publisher!


Update 1/9/18: unfortunately, for various reasons the production of this game has been canceled. There may be some interest from another publisher, so cross your fingers. Meanwhile, I've uploaded all the files to the game as print-and-play.

name: Bad Beets
description:
Bad Beets is a fast-paced bluffing card game in which players must eat their vegetables — well, get rid of their vegetables through any means that they can.

Each player starts the game with eight beet cards that they must finish before they can leave the dinner table. On a turn, a player takes one of the two cards in hand, places it facedown on the table, then takes an action — from feeding the dog, sharing with another player, tattling on someone, or actually eating a beet — and the other players decide whether to allow the action or call the player on it. If the player is called out, they take the action only if they have the proper card in hand and the tattletale gets punished with an extra beet.

name: Das Superhelden-Riesenspielbrettbuch
description:
The book has a compartment for game token and an electronic die.
The following simple roll-and-move-games:

Die Spinne ist Spider-Man
Die Fantastischen Vier (The Fantastic Four)
X-Men
Wolverine
Die Rächer (The Avengers)
Der unglaubliche Hulk

name: Cardville
description:
In Cardville players take on the roll of mayor of a developing town, growing it by adding more districts, developing existing ones, and adding landmarks.

On their turn a player rolls 3 dice and allocates the results to increasing their cash reserves and gathering resources, but they must choose carefully because the result of the remaining dice is given to their opponent and used by them to gather resources.

They must also beware of rolling triples, as the result is never good - alien abductions, meteor strikes or riots are just some of the calamities triggered by the wrong roll!

The game uses a deck of cards to represent districts and landmarks that players may purchase and add to their growing town.  Coloured tokens are used to record resources and cash, and also to represent areas of the town that have been developed.

Undeveloped plots can generate resources, but developed ones generate victory points at the end of the game.

name: Les Quatre-Bras & Waterloo 1815: The Empire's Final Blows
description:
Les Quatre-Bras and Waterloo 1815 is a complete game in the Jours de Gloire series. It covers the battles which occurred on June 16th and 18th, during Napoléon’s offensive in Belgium against the armies of Wellington and Blücher.

Les Quatre-Bras 1815 involves Ney and a single French corps attempting to secure a strategic crossroad defended by detachments under the Prince of Orange and Wellington.

Waterloo 1815 is the most famous and the most decisive battle of the Napoleonic era. The Emperor's last gambit was to achieve a great victory before Wellington and Blücher could unite their armies.

Les Quatre-Bras, June 16th 1815: Ney vs. the Prince of Orange and Wellington
Waterloo, June 18th 1815: Napoléon vs. Wellington and Blücher

Les Quatre-Bras and Waterloo are the 39th and 40th battles of the Jours de Gloire series.

The game includes an A1 map (backprinted), a color player aid, 434 counters and markers and 8 bags for the counters.

Rules and Charts are available in English or French (two different versions).

name: Foe Hunters
description:
Foe Hunters is an exciting co-operative, multiplayer deckbuilding/adventure game set in the realm of high fantasy! Players take the role of heroes that are working together to thwart the evil Foe. On their adventure the heroes will work together in an effort to bolster their party and fend off this powerful enemy. The players will harness mighty abilities and powerful equipment while they work as a team to rid the world of this wretched evil!

Each round starts with the Foe, who is autonomous. The Foe has a set action it takes each turn, and then plays cards from its deck. The cards in the Foe deck include Vassals under its employ that also fight the Heroes, as well as powerful abilities that the Foe will use to damage and weaken the Heroes. At the end of the Foe phase, the party of Heroes may collectively choose a card in the city to refresh, making other options available for the next turn.

After the Foe phase is complete, the party of Heroes begin their turns. Turn order starts with whoever the party selects. Each Hero turn plays out very simply, they can play a card from their hand, buy a card from the city (using their experience), and use one of their heroic Feats. Each Hero has a completely unique starting deck and plays totally different from each other Hero!

Play continues until the Foe is defeated or the party is destroyed, whichever happens first. In Foe Hunters, players don't use cards to buy cards like most deck building games. Each Hero has their own experience pool that they draw upon to purchase cards, and when these cards are purchased they go directly to hand instead of to your discard pile. This allows you to get answers for problems when you need them.

The deck building element in Foe Hunters revolves around the City Deck. This deck has several cards that are available for purchase. Many of these cards have a class affinity, which allows the Hero that matches the class to purchase the card for a discount.

Foe Hunters is a new take on co-op that mixes a lightweight system with the complexity of an in-depth deck building game or card game!

name: Samuel Sandwich
description:
A Gentleman's Game Of Cannibalism

Players take on the role of wealthy victorian era socialites and compete through braggadocious storytelling to determine who is the most interesting person. The only problem is that when money is no object what could you possibly wager with? Well winning a hand in Samuel Sandwich may be more literal than you might think.

Samuel Sandwich is designed for 2 to 4 players
The game consists of cards, playmats, counters and coins.

Each player is dealt a hand of “doings & deeds” cards each of theses cards has a selection of color coded words which are used to construct a story. These cards also contain a custom Samuel Sandwich suit and a point value so that at the end of each round your point total can be determined.

At the beginning of the round a “consorts & cohorts” card is flipped to reveal a famous historical figure. This person will be the subject of everyone’s  story as they try to outplay each other. There are 2 wagering rounds one when the “consorts & cohorts” card is revealed and then again when players select and place the cards they will be using face down on the table.
after wagering is resolved players take turns revealing and telling their story to the group. After everyone has told their tall tale the points are added up and the winner takes the money bet during this round as well as all cards played during the round (minus their own).

Feeling hungry?

Winning A Hand
After winning a round a player may then select one part of another player to eat. The correct counter is removed from that persons player mat and is placed in the stomach of the round winner.

Trading In
Players may also trade in 10 doings and deeds cards they have won from other players to select an additional part to eat.

Selling Off
If a player finds themselves low on funds at any time in the game they may sell off a part to the highest bidder in order to replenish their financial stockpile to continue wagering.

At the end of the game the player who has eaten the most is declared the winner. 
The key to success is not what you eat, it’s who you eat and how much!

name: Aqua Park
description:
In 2055, with the land having been developed and polluted rapidly due to the explosive growth of population, all eyes are turning to the ocean as our source for survival — but roughly one thousand species go extinct each day from among the six million forms of marine life, the destruction taking place faster than the revitalization that must happen.

Now the Intergovernmental Oceanographic Commission (IOC) within the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) has been given a huge budget from the world powers to invest in marine life and acquire the resources needed to survive, to create an "Aqua Park" akin to Noah's Ark from legends that will protect marine life and allow for research into the nature of the ocean and coastal areas.

In Aqua Park, players each endeavor to create their own aqua park based on the four mission cards that they hold in hand and the $10 million in their starting pool. Each player uses one of four dice (4-sided, 6-sided, 8-sided, 12-sided) during the game to try to acquire marine life cards from the five ocean zones.

On a turn, a player rolls their die, pays to reroll (if desired), asks for die help from others (paying if their dice are used), then collects all the fish in one ocean zone that correspond to the die total. If the player collects marine life needed to complete a mission card, the player can discard one life card to score those points. They can buy new mission cards for $3, with a maximum of four cards in hand. (If a player acquires marine life they don't want, they can sell it for $3 million; penguins bring in $5 million.)

Every $5 million in hand is worth 1 point, and players race to collect 15 points first. Whoever does so wins!

name: Swipe it!: Take what's yours...
description:
In this exciting, fast paced card game, players are competing against each other to acquire as many cards from their opponents as possible! Some cards are worth more than others though, so be strategic about which cards you decide to “Swipe” from your foes!

The game is played in rounds, and in one single round only four "Master Points" are available for players to win, either splitting the points between the players, or one player winning them all. Rounds continue until a single player reaches five Master Points, in which they win the game. The four Master Points in any given round consist of the following: 1) Master Number Point 2) Master Color Point 3) Master Shape Point and 4) Master Total Point.

The game starts out with the dealer revealing the "Master Card" for that round (which is a Power Card that gets placed in the center of the playing field). The Master Card will have a number (1-10), a color (red,blue,purple,green), and a shape (X,O). Whatever the elements might be are what dictate the four ways to earn the "Master Points" in that round. For example: If the dealer reveals the Master Card that has the number 7, the color red, and the shape X, then players must steal cards from each other that have any of those elements (7s, reds, X's) and always high numbered cards. At the end of a round, players will reveal to each other all of the cards they have acquired throughout the round. In this example, the player who acquired the most cards with the number 7 wins the Master Number Point, the player who acquired the most cards with the color red wins the Master Color Point, the player who acquired the most cards with the shape X wins the Master Shape Point, and the player who acquired the highest sum after adding up the numbers on all acquired cards wins the Master Total Point.

There are only two main types of cards in Swipe it!™ There are the Power Cards (cards with a number, a color, and a shape; one of these cards gets promoted to master card at the beginning of the round) and then there are the Swipe Cards which have an "S" and a swipe arrow . Players need to combine one of each type of cards in order to initiate an attack against another player. Players can only acquire Power Cards from each other in order to gain points, where Swipe Cards simply allow the player's Power Cards to make an attack. In Swipe it!™ a combined pair (a Power Card combined with a Swipe Card) can always freely attack a lower numbered Power Card or enemy pair. Example: a 10 on a Black Swipe Card can freely attack an opponent's 9 on a Black Swipe Card). Now the intensity rises when you are using a combined pair to attack a higher numbered Power Card or enemy pair. This is where the dice and rock-paper-scissors comes into effect, where essentially the attacker is wagering their lower numbered Power Card in a series of battles against their opponent's higher numbered Power Card. If the attacker loses, their opponent acquires the attacker's Power Card in play. This is especially huge when the attacker is risking their Power Card that happens to match the "Master Number", "Master Color", "Master Shape", or is a high numbered card like a 9 or 10. On the other hand, if the attacker is wagering a Power Card that is low like the number 1 and does not match any of the Master Point categories, then who cares if they lose to their enemy right? The attacker may as well take the risk with that type of card in order try and win a great one.

There are also three different types of Swipe Cards (Black, Silver, and Gold) each one offering unique abilities; such as the Gold Swipe Card raising your Power card by +2 when it is attacking and by +1 when on defense, or the Silver Swipe Card granting the ability to "Punish" another player's Swipe Card, or being able to "Reassign" a combined pair with a different Power card (if you had a 1 combined with Silver Swipe Card, you can switch it to lets say a 10 on the Silver Swipe Card allowing you to attack higher numbered enemy cards for free). There are also some special rules too, such as "merge", "master merge", and "cash-in" which can help players out of some sticky situations. A "merge" allows you to combine two Power Cards that share the same number (such as combining a 9 with another 9), forcing the combined cards to act as if it were a Black Swipe card, giving you the ability to combine a third Power Card to it to make an attack. "Master merge" is the same as a "merge" with the exception that the combined cards match the "Master Number" in play, forcing them to act as if it were a Gold Swipe Card. Lastly, the "cash-in" action allows a player to discard two alike Swipe Cards (such as discarding two Black Swipe Cards) to receive one new card from the dealer. This action can only be done once per turn, so if you were hoping for a particular card, you will not be able to cash in another pair of Swipe Cards until the dealer makes its way around to you again.

The round ends once the dealer has dealt the last card, and the player dealt the last card takes their final turn. All players discard any remaining face up cards. They then flip over all acquired face down cards and determine the winners of the 4 Master Points for the round in this order; Master Number, Master Color, Master Shape, Master Total.

name: Earth Encounters
description:
Earth Encounters is a board game fueled by the concept that conversations among friends ignite big ideas that not only impact our world, but make it a better place as well. Earth Encounters brings the Einstein in all of us to life. It’s not only fun to play, but it sparks dialog among friends, brings value to our community, and perhaps can even change our world for the better! Earth Encounters is anti-trivia.

The game starts with the Timeship Encounter. An alien creature escaped the timeship and is hiding somewhere in the Eastern Time Zone. Encounter launches an elite team to recapture the alien creature. Players travel across the U.S. and the seven continents, competing to be the first to locate and capture the powerful yet invisible alien before it awakens and consumes all the knowledge possessed by Earth’s inhabitants. Throughout this adventure, each player learns about the states and continents as they collect as many states and continent deeds as possible – they’ll be needed when you come face-to-face with the alien creature.

Each player can only advance by correctly answering a question from the Q&A Deck or successfully completing a thought experiment from the Challenge Deck.   In doing so, if they are the first to land on that particular state or continent, they are awarded a State Deed of Trust.  That means the state or continent is now under the players protection from the alien. The player who protects the state where the alien is hiding is considered the winner!

name: Titan Race
description:
In Titan Race, each player is a rider astride a titan, racing on one of the many wild circuits of Neverworld. It's a short, brutal three laps as you jockey for position, ram your opponents, and leverage bonuses and your titan's abilities to race across the finish line!

The game board is an infinite circuit that wraps around at opposite sides. Each circuit has specific features that allow for interesting tactical maneuvers. Movement is governed by drafting dice from a pool rolled at the beginning of each round. If you choose a die that matches the color of your titan, you regain a life point.

When you ram into another titan by moving into the same space, you push that titan and deal them damage. There are also ways to lay traps on the circuit that will damage titans who encounter them. If you get KO'd due to taking too much damage, you'll spend a turn resetting right where you were knocked out, but you're not out of the race.

Each titan has a special ability that can be activated once each round. Moving into certain bonus spaces on the circuit also grant players bonus cards that can be played for additional effects.

name: Cauldron Quest

The object of Cauldron Quest is to get the three correct ingredients into the Cauldron before all six of the paths are blocked. The evil Wizard has cast a spell to destroy the kingdom! You have the power to create a potion to break the spell, but you must work together. Your quest is to find the three correct ingredients hidden under the potion bottles and move them up the paths and into the Cauldron before the Wizard blocks all of the paths. If you do not get all three potion bottles with correct ingredients to the Cauldron before the paths are blocked, the Wizard triumphs and the kingdom is destroyed.

Cauldron Quest is a game where everyone plays together, no one is left out, and everyone has fun! Traditional games tend to have one winner and one (or many) losers! In a cooperative game, the players work as a team against a common obstacle, not against each other.

name: Dinosaur Escape
description:
The object of Dinosaur Escape is to get all three dinosaurs safely to Dinosaur Island before the volcano erupts! Work together to move the dinosaur movers around the board and uncover the matching dinosaurs under the fern tokens.

On your turn, roll the die. If you roll a number, move any dinosaur mover the indicated number of spaces any direction on the path. Then turn over one fern token anywhere on the board. If you reveal rocks, bones or other items, flip the token back over. If you reveal a dinosaur, and the dinosaur mover of the same species is in the same habitat area, move the dinosaur moved and matching token to Dinosaur Island. You just helped a dinosaur escape!

If you reveal a dinosaur but the dinosaur mover of the same species is not in the same habitat as the token, flip the token back over. Dinosaur movers and matching tokens must be in the same habitat to help a dinosaur escape! If you turn over the T-Rex, RUN! Move each of the dinosaur movers in play back to a start space. If you roll a volcano, place volcano piece number 1 in the stand on the board. If you can find and help all three lost dinosaurs escape to Dinosaur Island before completing the 3D volcano puzzle, you all win!

name: This or That?
description:
The object of This or That? is to discover fun and interesting things about the other players. Each token in the game bag has two questions – one on each side, and each question has two options – This or That. Most of the questions give you a choice between things you might like, such as “Pumpkin Pie or S’Mores?”. Other questions might give you a choice between things you might not enjoy, such as “Smelly or Slimy?”. In either case, you might really like both of the answers, or neither of them. That’s the catch – you HAVE to pick one answer!
Players take turns drawing tokens from the bag. Silently read your token and decide which side you want to answer. Read that question out loud. Decide what your answer is but don’t say it out loud! Each players guesses what they think your answer is. After all the players have guessed, reveal your answer and be honest! If you draw a black All Play token, read the question out loud, and everyone takes turns sharing their answer to the question.

Keep the token you drew and pass the bag along to the next player. The game ends when everyone has five This or That? tokens in front of them.

name: Havets konung
description:
- En kappsegling runt Gotland (A race around Gotland).

The players competing in a race around the Island Gotland in the Baltic sea. The boats are moving by picking up the right picture from facedown tiles that correspond to a field in front of the playing piece. If a wrong tile are picked, then the boat have to move back. The tiles are put back in the same place and after a while you have to trust your memory to pick the right tile.

name: Open Field Battle
description:
Open Field Battle is a simple wargame portraying generic 17th-century combat; no specific battle is represented.

Each player has a force of pikemen, cavalry, musketeers, and cannons. Each turn a player gets a random number of command points to spend on musketeers and cannons firing and on pikemen and cavalry moving and assaulting.

Combat is deterministic; the result depends on the formation the defender is in and the status of the defender and any neighboring units. E.g., a lone defender or one at the end of a line is disrupted (or eliminated if already disrupted), but one with two undisrupted neighbors merely retreats. The neighboring units may suffer effects as well.

Optional rules allow for different ways of using the command points and the possibility of saving them from turn to turn.

name: Credo!: The Game of the Early Church
description:
As in the original Credo, in Credo!: The Game of the Early Church players compete to get their versions of the articles of the Nicene Creed voted in. There are numerous event cards which affect the proceedings.

This edition makes some significant changes, among which are:

     The game can be played with up to eight players, although play mats for just six are provided.
     The alternate winning conditions (11 million flock or 117 council votes) have been eliminated.
     The game ends when the creed is complete or when the event deck is exhausted.
     The creed is divided into 13 articles instead of 10, and there are furthermore additional optional articles (designated X, Y, and Z) which the Emperor can choose to vote on at any time. (Consequently, players can have up to 12 articles on their mats instead of 9.)
     All flock cards have the same value.

name: Soulfall
description:
In Soulfall, players lead their nomads across a barren landscape, saved from the brink of destruction by a collective of powerful Lords.  Along the way, players can devote themselves to these Lords, build outposts, and gather shards, all while trying to prevent the other players from doing the same.

Soulfall is a medium-light game that combines simple mechanisms, medium strategy, stunning artwork, clever card play, and a unique scoring system.
